alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:32AM PDT until July 05 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around Humboldt Bay, particularly at King Salmon and Jackson Ranch road in the Arcata Bottoms. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 2 AM PDT Wednesday.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that above normal tides will generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
